column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: means that you need to stop.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column10: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 2. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 3. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: can handle
column6: must yield to
column8: must interrupt

column4: Cars in right lane must slow down
column6: Merging traffic ahead
column8: No left turn
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column4: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 6. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column6: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column8: you may stop to let out passengers.
column10: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.

column2: 7. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column4: suggested
column6: maximum
column8: minimum

column4: Merging Traffic
column6: Curve ahead
column8: Road work ahead

column4: Stay on the main highway if possible
column6: Detour to the right
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 10. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column6: Vehicles may only turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column4: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column6: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column8: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column10: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.

column2: 14. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column6: turn on your headlights only.
column8: turn off all your lights.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 15. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 16. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Octagon
column6: Pennant
column8: Upside-down triangle

column4: a steep grade is ahead.
column6: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column8: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column10: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.

column4: Railroad Crossing
column6: One Way
column8: Playground warning

column2: 19. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.

column4: Sharp turn ahead.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column10: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 21. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: sound the horn.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column4: Average-Beam System
column6: Anti-Braking System
column8: Anti-Buzz-Steering

column2: 23. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 24. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the steering ability.
column6: It improves the vehicle stability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 25. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column8: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
